poem:
**The Ranking**

Numbers, an indifferent gospel,  
teeth gritted against the  
cold honesty of leagues.  
A class of bright enamel,  
grapples for a crown  
in sterile halls, where  
knowledge is chiselled away,  
brushing aspirations onto  
charts, while roots of  
wisdom remain unlisted,  
sinking deeper into  
unmeasured earth.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Best UK universities for dentistry – league table default". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Best UK universities for dentistry – league table default
